identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of Saxagliptin in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Who Have Inadequate Blood Sugar Control With Sulfonylureas
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind Placebo-Controlled Phase 3 Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Saxagliptin in Combination With Glyburide in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control With Glyburide Alone

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this trial is to understand if adding saxagliptin to a sulfonylurea is safe and works better than increasing the amount of sulfonylurea a patient takes
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: All subjects will participate in a lead-in period, and qualifying subjects will continue into a short-term randomized treatment period. Subjects who complete the short-term period will be eligible to enter the long term extension period. Also, subjects in the short-term period who have an elevated blood sugar that requires additional medication for blood sugar control (defined as rescue) will be eligible to enter the long-term treatment extension period where they will receive metformin.Rescue treatment with metformin is also available during the long-term extension period for subjects who meet glycemic criteria.

interventions.name: Saxagliptin
interventions.description: Tablets, Oral, 2.5 mg, Daily AM, (24 weeks short-term \[ST\], 12 months long-term \[LT\])

interventions.name: Saxagliptin
interventions.description: Tablets, Oral, 5 mg, Daily AM (24 weeks ST, 12 months LT).

interventions.name: Glyburide
interventions.description: Capsules, Oral, OL, 7.5 mg, Daily, AM (24 weeks ST, 12 months LT)

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Tablets, Oral, 0 mg, Daily AM/PM, (24 weeks ST, 12 months LT)

interventions.name: Glyburide
interventions.description: Capsules, Oral, DB Glyburide, 2.5 mg titrated to 7.5 mg + 7.5 mg OL, Daily AM/PM (24 weeks ST, 12 months LT)

interventions.name: Metformin
interventions.description: Tablets, Oral, OL, 500 - 2500 mg, 1 or 2 times per day (12 months LT)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (A1C) at Week 24
primaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline in A1C at Week 24, adjusted for baseline value.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline in FPG at Week 24, adjusted for baseline value.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving A1C < 7% at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants achieving A1C \< 7%, the American Diabetes Association's defined goal for glycemia, at each dose of saxagliptin plus glyburide versus placebo plus upward titrated glyburide at Week 24.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes From Baseline in Postprandial Glucose (PPG) Area Under the Curve (AUC) Response to an Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT) at Week 24
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean change from baseline for 0 to 180 minutes PPG AUC at Week 24, adjusted for baseline values.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Type 2 Diabetes.
* Treated with a sulfonylurea for at least 2 months.
* Inadequate blood sugar control.
* Are not on any other medications to lower blood sugar.
* No major heart, liver or kidney problems.
* Women not pregnant or breast feeding.

locations.facility: Family Care Assoc & Emerald Care Res Grp
University Of Miami Diabetes Research Inst.
Family Medical Center Of Hart Co.
St. Louis Center For Clinical Research
Texas Center For Drug Development, P.A.
Diabetes & Glandular Disease Research Assoc, Pa

references.citation: Chacra AR, Tan GH, Apanovitch A, Ravichandran S, List J, Chen R; CV181-040 Investigators. Saxagliptin added to a submaximal dose of sulphonylurea improves glycaemic control compared with uptitration of sulphonylurea in patients with type 2 diabetes: a randomised controlled trial. Int J Clin Pract. 2009 Sep;63(9):1395-406. doi: 10.1111/j.1742-1241.2009.02143.x. Epub 2009 Jul 15. Erratum In: Int J Clin Pract. 2010 Jan;64(2):277.

Perl S, Cook W, Wei C, Iqbal N, Hirshberg B. Saxagliptin Efficacy and Safety in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes and Moderate Renal Impairment. Diabetes Ther. 2016 Sep;7(3):527-35. doi: 10.1007/s13300-016-0184-9. Epub 2016 Jul 11.

Bonora E, Bryzinski B, Hirshberg B, Cook W. A post hoc analysis of saxagliptin efficacy and safety in patients with type 2 diabetes stratified by UKPDS 10-year cardiovascular risk score. Nutr Metab Cardiovasc Dis. 2016 May;26(5):374-9. doi: 10.1016/j.numecd.2015.11.004. Epub 2015 Dec 1.

Karyekar CS, Frederich R, Ravichandran S. Clinically relevant reductions in HbA1c without hypoglycaemia: results across four studies of saxagliptin. Int J Clin Pract. 2013 Aug;67(8):759-67. doi: 10.1111/ijcp.12212. Epub 2013 Jun 24.

Karyekar C, Donovan M, Allen E, Fleming D, Ravichandran S, Chen R. Efficacy and safety of saxagliptin combination therapy in US patients with type 2 diabetes. Postgrad Med. 2011 Jul;123(4):63-70. doi: 10.3810/pgm.2011.07.2305.

Chacra AR, Tan GH, Ravichandran S, List J, Chen R; CV181040 Investigators. Safety and efficacy of saxagliptin in combination with submaximal sulphonylurea versus up-titrated sulphonylurea over 76 weeks. Diab Vasc Dis Res. 2011 Apr;8(2):150-9. doi: 10.1177/1479164111404574.

groups.title: Saxagliptin 2.5 mg + Glyburide 7.5 mg
groups.description: The Saxagliptin 2.5 mg + Glyburide 7.5 mg group includes data from subjects randomized to receive coadministration of blinded saxagliptin 2.5 mg oral tablets and open-label glyburide 7.5 mg oral tables once daily. Open-label glyburide may have been down titrated by 2.5 mg once due to hypoglycemia as deemed necessary by the investigator.

groups.title: Saxagliptin 5 mg + Glyburide 7.5 mg
groups.description: The Saxagliptin 5 mg + Glyburide 7.5 mg group includes data from subjects randomized to receive coadministration of blinded saxagliptin 5 mg oral tablets and open-label glyburide 7.5 mg oral tables once daily. Open-label glyburide may have been down titrated by 2.5 mg once due to hypoglycemia as deemed necessary by the investigator.

groups.title: Placebo + Glyburide 7.5 mg
groups.description: The Placebo + Glyburide 7.5 mg group includes data from subjects randomized to receive coadministration of blinded placebo oral tablets, blinded glyburide 2.5 mg, and open-label glyburide 7.5 mg once daily. Open-label glyburide may have been down titrated by 2.5 mg once due to hypoglycemia as deemed necessary by the investigator. Blinded glyburide may have been uptitrated by 5 mg according to glycemic criteria provided it had not been previously down-titrated.

achievements.comment: 61 subjects completed the study without being rescued
55 subjects completed the study without being rescued
26 subjects completed the study without being rescued

dropWithdraws.type: Subject No Longer Meets Study Criteria

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (A1C) at Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change from baseline in A1C at Week 24, adjusted for baseline value.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment. To be included in analysis of change from baseline to Week 24 Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF), participants must have had a baseline and at least 1 post-baseline measurement. If participant received rescue medication, measurement must have been taken before rescue.

groups.title: Saxagliptin 2.5 mg + Glyburide 7.5 mg

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.

ancestors.term: Hormones, Hormone Substitutes, and Hormone Antagonists
